sources.title: From Beyond The Grave (1974)
sources.description: From Beyond the Grave is a 1974 British anthology horror film from Amicus Productions, directed by Kevin Connor, produced by Milton Subotsky and based on short stories by R. Chetwynd-Hayes. It featuring four interconnected stories centered around an antique shop called Temptations Limited. Each tale explores the dark consequences faced by customers who either buy or steal cursed items, leading to supernatural and often deadly outcomes.

metadata.Plot: Anthology film from Amicus adapted from four short stories by R. Chetwynd-Hayes strung together about an antique dealer who owns a shop called Temptations Ltd. and the fate that befalls his customers who try to cheat him. Stories include "The Gate Crasher" with David Warner who frees an evil entity from an antique mirror, "An Act of Kindness" featuring Donald Pleasence, "The Elemental", and "The Door".
metadata.Writer: Robin Clarke, Raymond Christodoulou, R. Chetwynd-Hayes
metadata.Actors: Peter Cushing, Ian Bannen, Ian Carmichael
